lyrics.lyrics:
Verse 1
It goes a little like this,
Out living life like my life was a bliss,
Young, dumb and reckless,
Taking the piss,
Never took the time to sit and reminisce,
But I never would’ve thought,
I’d change with a kiss,

But I changed with a kiss,

And see, the first time I laid out my eyes on your face
it arised that there’s more to this world than I’ve seen,
I have been,
Living in disguise,
Covering my eyes from that thing we call reality, see

Every day we spent,
I really felt content,
Knowing that I found,
Someone there for me,
And someone I can be,

Yeah,

See we would drive so far in a car to a place that I don’t know where we are,
Daydream living out like a movie star,
Never overthought, even thoughts that were bizarre,
We just kept on living didn’t matter where we were,

I knew there was a limit to these days,
Go our separate ways,
Maybe treat it as a phase,
I knew deep down as I gazed in your eyes there was more to be praised but,

When that day come,
We were in the airport,
Quarter past one,
Time seem to freeze, and my heart weighed a ton,
I didn’t understand what we had begun,
But you left from my sight,
My body turned numb,

I’m driving home alone,

Driving on my own,

Wondering the future that we’ll have,
On a phone,
So won’t you,

Chorus x2
Tell me that you love me,
Tell me that you need me,
Even when I’m gone,
And when you can’t feel me yeah,
Oh yeah yeah yeah,

Verse 2
As the weeks went by,
I was counting down the days from the day we said bye,
Waiting for the day when we both say hi,
Was living in the future let the present go by,
And then before you know it one day we said hi,

I was shy,
Didn’t think to smile,
Or to cry,
The feeling was strange, no lie,
So we kept our range, stand by
Until we got back to normal,
It took about a day,
But you only stayed a day,
And then you went away,
Again, but then,

I dipped on a plane to the land that you came from,
Met all your friends and your fam,
I felt welcome there,
Swear there was a difference in the air,
I finally found a place to escape somewhere,
So yeah,

And as my journey came to an end,
I sat on the end of your bed with a tear in my eye and I said,
“I can’t say bye, why don’t we just give this a try?”,
So won’t you,

Chorus x2
Tell me that you love me,
Tell me that you need me,
Even when I’m gone,
And when you can’t feel me yeah,
Oh yeah yeah yeah,

Verse 3
See I would hop on a plane every two months,
Or maybe even more,
Distance wasn’t something to ignore,
Every time that saw it refreshed what it’s for,
So I kept coming back to get more,

Your hug was a drug to me,
I knew that it would set me free,
Free from reality,
Out with normality,
Changed my mentality,
See the world in a different view now,

But every time you left from my side,
I always had a feeling like a part of me died on the inside,
On the outside I cried,
Cried until my eyes dried,

So now I can respect all the time that we can be together,
In good or bad weather doesn’t matter,
Wherever we are it feels better with you by,
My side together,
So won’t you,

Chorus x2
Tell me that you love me,
Tell me that you need me,
Even when I’m gone,
And when you can’t feel me yeah,
Oh yeah yeah yeah,

Whistle

Verse 1
Does anyone know?
The road the route they choose,
Doors they closed,
The cons before the pros,

It shows,
That when you sit up, compose,
And figure out where it all goes,
It isn’t that hard I suppose,

But I was eighteen,
Out living life like a daydream,
Out following the same scheme,
Where to pass an exam was the main theme,

But it didn’t seem,
That the points I would get would position me,
That the score I would get it would limit me,
That the grade I would get tell me where to be,

We had decisions,
When really there were only two decisions,
Either pick a four-year course or drop and then go and join the workforce,

So its simple,
If you could eliminate the pressure,
The pressure to achieve the best success,
For the people that surround you and the people that believe,

Chorus
Everyone talks like everyone knows,
Everyone thinks that everyone knows,
Does anyone know?
Does anyone know?

Verse 2
Look,
Now I think about who I could be,
Now I think I’m running on the roads that I should be,
Now as I sit down with a cup of tea,
Dipping a biscuit,
Enjoying the scenery,

Exploring all the back roads,
That are all new to me,
Understanding things that I want don’t just come to me,
Have to put the effort and the work in,
Now I’m putting effort and some work in,
Now if off track,
And returning back to the story,

Yeah,

Back to a time,
Where people used to put all the pressure on my mind,
Looking to the future,
When really I was blind,

I really only thought about the next game,
Will I have a nickname,
Popularity in the class really was fame,
Never really thought about the future I would proclaim,
Now I’m on a road with myself to blame,

But anyway,
It doesn’t really matter in the end,
Coz the end of the road is where everyone goes,
No matter what you chose,
And that’s something everyone knows.

Chorus
Everyone talks like everyone knows,
Everyone thinks that everyone knows,
Does anyone know?
Does anyone know?

Verse 1
Is there any reason,
To live without an aim?
Is this life just a game?
In this world we're the same,
Have to work,
Then we claim out a pension,
Paid for our detention,
Now it's time to talk,
Can I ask you pay attention,

And focus,

Focus on your time,
The day moves quickly then soon it will be night-time,
The life that I'm living it is part-time,
spent most of my daytime study in a college,

Yeah,

Study in a college,
just so I can gain the knowledge,
that one day I will acknowledge,
Myself as a man,
Independent living with a plan,
Play my cards in the best way I can, but,

Time's on my mind it's too hard to understand,
The past I have lived,
And the future I have planned,
Always living life like I'm living on demand,
If you ask how I'm doing I will always say I'm grand,

Chorus X2
I ain’t got a reason for this game,
We are human beings we’re same,
We always point a finger at who to blame,
For problems that we never overcame,

Verse 2
I’m doing 20 in a 40 zone,
Laid back cruising,
Unaware of the next road I am choosing,
Abusing,
The clutch and the gear I’m using,
Refusing,
To speed up to find out,
If there’s any reason,

To live out in the fast lane,
To see my life move past like a speed train,
To work everyday just to retain a job,
where the stress makes it harder to maintain,

And when I finish school I’m in the main game,
A new player coming in with a new aim,
But the aim that I set is the same as the rest,
So I guess,
That it doesn’t make me different,

So we are all alike,
Think we are moving on a stationary bike,
Select a course to go somewhere,
Even if you don’t know where to go and know how,
You will find in this life what you need,

Yeah,

Nothings guaranteed,
We just peddle on the bike til we bleed,
When you stop you are freed,
From this world full of greed,
Where the money is the only thing they feed.

Chorus X2
I ain’t got a reason for this game,
We are human beings we’re same,
We always point a finger at who to blame,
For problems that we never overcame,

Verse 1
As I'm here remising through the days,
I’ve really through away,
Am I overthinking?
Have my thoughts gone astray?
Am I even living if I’m living day to day?
But I thought to myself,

Yeah,

I thought to myself that,
How do I become the man I want to be?
Do I lay back and just live carefree?
Or do I follow all my senses?

Yeah,

Follow all my senses,
To put me on the path,
Fate has set for me,
Take a step back,
Am I even free?

It doesn’t look like I’m free will living and I’m making my decisions,
There’s a sub-conscious mind that is making my decisions,
And it’s playing with the visions of my life,
Tell me where to go,
Tell me where to be,

Look,

Define what the meaning is of free,
Live safe in a broke society,
Work everyday without wisdom,
So that you can pay everyday for your freedom,

But what do we give?
Systematically is how we live,
The routine stays the same we relive,
The routine stays the same we relive,
So do we live free or do we have freedom?

Chorus
Do we live free or do we have freedom?
Do we free or do we just,
Live in a world that is set for us,
We have fate,
Free will,
Will direct for us,
We just live in a world that is set for us,
We have fate,
Free will,
Will direct for us,

Verse 2
As I'm here remising through the days,
I’ve really through away,
Am I overthinking?
Have my thoughts gone astray?
Am I even living if I’m living day to day?
But I thought to myself,

Yeah,

I thought to myself that,
How do I begin,
This life that I’m in,
Maybe there’s a rule book,
Or there’s a way to look,
Maybe there’s a system,

Yeah,

Maybe there’s a system in place,
Just in case,
That if anyone will step out of line,
There’s a fine,
Societies immaculate design, look,

If you’re not following the rules,
Then your out on the streets,
Picking pennies from the people,
That are working to survive,
Stay alive,
Money thrives,
In this world,
If you don’t have some,
Will not stay alive,

On this earth isn’t that what makes you free?
If money brings you happiness,
How happy can you be?
It will have a cost with the time that you’ve lost,
That’s why I question myself and I ask,
Do I have freedom?

Chorus
Do I live free or do we have freedom?
Do I free or do I just,
Live in a world that is set for me,
I have fate,
Free will,
Will direct for me,
I just live in a world that is set for me,
I have fate,
Free will,
Will direct for me,
Yeah

Verse 1
When you look in direction,
Tell me what you see,
Do I have potential?
Or someone I can be?
Do I blend into society pretend that I am free?
Lost and confused,
But I’m searching for the key,

Look,

Social living,
Friends keep giving,
Giving up their time when the clock keeps ticking,
It’s the people in your life that will make you start living,
Ready, set, go,
So you better start picking out the real ones,

Forget all the fake ones,
Negativity is the curse of this world, son,
Do we even have fun?
We start in the long run,
Pushing out the pack,
In the hopes to be someone,

This is just a mindset,
It rains then I get wet,
Walk home soaking,
Arrive now I’m upset,
Sitting by the fire looking out at the sunset,
Reflecting on the things that I still haven’t done yet,
It’s crazy,

Chorus X2
Take it with a pinch of salt,
And that’s just all you need,
Focus on your time,
Not the money and the greed,
Success can come quickly,
But it’s never guaranteed,
The money comes back,
But the time will proceed,

Verse 2
When you look in direction,
Tell me what you see,
Do I have potential?
Or someone I can be?
Do I blend into society pretend that I am free?
Lost and confused,
But I’m searching for the key,

Look,

Growing up I always wanted to be older,
Playing life with a game and a controller,
Now I’m in this world with this weight upon my shoulder,
Living with a fear of the fear of getting older,

This is day to day living,
Time is unforgiving,
Keep an eye on the clock,
The hands keep spinning,
I’ve realised that things in life will always go missing,
Grateful for the goods I got,
And love I’ve been given,

Time over money,
Love your body and your mind,
Peace love and positivity is what you’ll find,
Focus on myself more,
That’s how I stay refined,
Gym, college, music,
Yeah I really love the grind,

I help all the people around me when they’re in trouble,
We all know life is just one big endless puzzle,
We go piece by piece,
We go day by day,
We stay cool this way,
And we should all just take it with a,

Chorus X2
Take it with a pinch of salt,
And that’s just all you need,
Focus on your time,
Not the money and the greed,
Success can come quickly,
But it’s never guaranteed,
The money comes back,
But the time will proceed,
